publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7768 John Lamont: Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or—That the Parliament congratulates the Tuke family and the staff at Hardies Mill Farm in the Borders on being selected by Quality Meat Scotland to supply produce for the 2011 Bocuse d’Or taking place in Lyon from 22 to 26 January 2011; recognises that Le Bocuse d’Or is widely considered to be the culinary version of the Olympic Games, attracting top young chefs from around the world; considers this to be a tremendous vote of confidence in the quality of produce available from farms in Scotland, and welcomes the opportunity for local produce to be on show at such a highly regarded and influential event.
S3M-7768 Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or (lodged on 21 January 2011) Jim Hume*

S3M-7768 Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or (lodged on 21 January 2011) Bill Aitken*, Robert Brown*, Bill Kidd*, Jackson Carlaw*, Murdo Fraser*, Elizabeth Smith*, Rob Gibson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jamie McGrigor*, Stewart Maxwell*, Nanette Milne*, Ted Brocklebank*
S3M-7768 Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or (lodged on 21 January 2011) Linda Fabiani*
S3M-7768 Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or (lodged on 21 January 2011) Margaret Mitchell*
S3M-7768 Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or (lodged on 21 January 2011) Maureen Watt*
S3M-7768 Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or (lodged on 21 January 2011) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7768 John Lamont: Scottish Produce at Le Bocuse d’Or—That the Parliament congratulates the Tuke family and the staff at Hardies Mill Farm in the Borders on being selected by Quality Meat Scotland to supply produce for the 2011 Bocuse d’Or taking place in Lyon from 22 to 26 January 2011; recognises that Le Bocuse d’Or is widely considered to be the culinary version of the Olympic Games, attracting top young chefs from around the world; considers this to be a tremendous vote of confidence in the quality of produce available from farms in Scotland, and welcomes the opportunity for local produce to be on show at such a highly regarded and influential event. Supported by: Jim Hume, Bill Aitken, Robert Brown, Bill Kidd, Jackson Carlaw, Murdo Fraser, Elizabeth Smith, Rob Gibson, Kenneth Gibson, Jamie McGrigor, Stewart Maxwell, Nanette Milne, Ted Brocklebank, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Mitchell, Maureen Watt, Stuart McMillan
